conversation.message:
Dear Nursery_B,

I’m Parent_B. Thank you for your update last round and for confirming Round 12 as your decision point.

As we are now in Round 12, I would like to formally apply again for the available place. If you are able to move forward with me, I can accept immediately today and complete all enrollment paperwork and any required deposit the same day. We are fully flexible on start date and hours.

Could you please confirm whether any higher-priority family has taken an actionable step by now, and if not, whether you are able to offer the place to me at this point?

Thank you very much for your time and consideration.

Sincerely,
Parent_B
conversation.thought: Only Nursery_B remains unmatched and it is on my true preference list (ranked 3rd). Nursery_B indicated Round 12 as the definitive checkpoint to decide whether any higher-priority family has taken an actionable step; if not, they would review next-in-line families. To maximize my chance, I should submit a clear, final [APPLY] now, reiterating immediate acceptance, paperwork/deposit readiness, and flexibility, while explicitly asking for the Round 12 status decision.

conversation.message:
Dear Parent_B,

Thank you for your message and for reapplying in Round 12.

As of now, we have not received an actionable step (formal application/confirmation) from any higher-priority family, and we are able to move forward. We are pleased to offer you the available place at Nursery_B.

Please reply to confirm acceptance, and we will send the enrollment paperwork and deposit details for same-day completion.

Sincerely,
Nursery_B

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: Nursery_B’s true priority is D > A > B > C > E. The only active applicant is Parent_B, who is 3rd on our list and acceptable. However, Parent_D (our top) ranks Nursery_B as their 2nd choice and could still come if not matched elsewhere; Parent_A ranks us 3rd and could also come. Parent_B ranks us 3rd and is very ready to accept, reducing vacancy risk. Given we already set Round 12 as the decision point and have no evidence that higher-priority families are engaging with us now, accepting Parent_B now secures a match and avoids continued vacancy. If a higher-priority parent appears later, we cannot switch, but the cost of waiting further is likely higher than the expected benefit at this stage. Therefore accept Parent_B.
